# STS proposal comparison

```{r}
library(ggplot2)
theme_set(theme_bw(16) + theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 30, hjust = 1),
                               strip.background = element_blank()))

ess <- read.csv('output/ess_calls.csv', as.is=TRUE)
# R 3.1.0 "change"/bug
ess <- transform(ess, last_ess = as.numeric(last_ess))

ess$by_length <- ifelse(ess$by_length == 'True', 'by length', 'by edge')
```

## Partials updates:

Number of likelihood calls required by various proposal methods:

```{r, fig.width = 12}
p <- ggplot(ess, aes(x = paste(proposal_method, by_length), y = likelihood_calls)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  facet_grid(n_taxa ~ trim_count) +
  scale_y_log10()
print(p)
```

## ... and effective sample size:

```{r, fig.width = 12}
p <- ggplot(ess, aes(x = paste(proposal_method, by_length), y = last_ess)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  facet_grid(n_taxa ~ trim_count)
print(p)
```
## ASDSF

[Average Standard Deviation of Split Frequencies (ASDSF)](http://www.bali-phy.org/README.html#idp54307728)

```{r, fig.width = 10, fig.height = 10}
library(stringr)
asdsf <- read.csv('output/asdsf.csv', as.is=TRUE)

asdsf$by_length <- ifelse(asdsf$by_length == 'True', 'by length', 'by edge')
asdsf <- transform(asdsf, proposal = paste(proposal_method, by_length),
                   n_trimmed = paste('trim', str_count(trim_taxon, '-') + 1),
                   n_taxa = paste(n_taxa, 'taxa'))

p <- ggplot(asdsf, aes(x = proposal, y = asdsf, fill=type)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  geom_hline(yintercept = 0.01, linetype = 'dashed') +
  facet_grid(n_trimmed ~ n_taxa) +
  theme(legend.position = 'bottom')
print(p)

```
